alert.note: Alert for Clark; Dallas; Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Montgomery; Pike; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 05 at 11:37AM CDT until May 05 at 2:40PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Garland County in central Arkansas... Grant County in central Arkansas... Southeastern Saline County in central Arkansas... Clark County in southwestern Arkansas... Dallas County in southwestern Arkansas... Hot Spring County in southwestern Arkansas... Pike County in southwestern Arkansas... Southeastern Montgomery County in western Arkansas... * Until 240 PM CDT. * At 1137 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches will be possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hot Springs, Benton, Bryant, Arkadelphia, Malvern, Sheridan, Murfreesboro, Haskell, Glenwood, Gurdon, Rockport, Amity, Caddo Valley, Traskwood, Leola, Tull, Sparkman, Carthage, Prattsville and Poyen. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Dallas; Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Montgomery; Pike; Saline
